news_header: Managing directors of AI companies often have close ties with the government, raising questions about trust and data usage, especially with the new Chinese AI program Deepseek.
news_text: Tarmo Toikkanen, a leading expert from Sitra, emphasizes the importance of scrutinizing the information fed into AI applications and the trustworthiness of their operators. The recent launch of the Chinese AI program Deepseek has sparked discussions about its effectiveness compared to American competitors and its close ties with the Chinese government. Toikkanen warns that users should be cautious about the data they share with such services, a sentiment echoed by Professor Teemu Roos from the University of Helsinki. Deepseek has quickly gained popularity, becoming the most downloaded free app in the U.S., surpassing Chat GPT.
